definitions.definition: a small thin piece of metal with a point at one end, especially used for temporarily holding pieces of cloth together:
examples: I'll keep the trouser patch in place with pins while I sew it on.
If you pull the pin out of a hand-grenade, it'll explode.

definitions.definition: a decorative object, used as jewellery:
to fasten something with a pin:
examples: A large picture of the president was pinned to/(up) on the office wall.

definitions.definition: When a young man pins a young woman, he gives her a piece of jewellery to show that they love each other.
abbreviation for  personal identification number : a secret number that a person uses together with a special card to get money from their bank account out of a machine, or when paying by credit card
